document.heading: District of Columbia Traffic Amendment Act of 1985

history.narrative: Law 6-38, the “District of Columbia Traffic Amendment Act of 1985,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-12, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 11, 1985, and June 25, 1985, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 11, 1985, it was assigned Act No. 6-56 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
